item.title: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said - ET Now
item.description:
Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said

Updated: January 5, 2025 09:20 IST

Bengaluru's Yellow Line, connecting RV Road to Bommasandra, has generated excitement but the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has denied January 6, 2025, launch rumors. The first train will be unveiled on that date, with subsequent deliveries scheduled.

  • The Yellow Line will span 18.82 kilometers with 18 stations.
  • MP Tejasvi Surya confirmed the delivery schedule of trains.
  • The initial operations will feature three trains, expanding by August 2025.
“I am equally frustrated with the repeated delays in the start of the Yellow Line.” – Tejasvi Surya

The Yellow Line is anticipated to enhance connectivity in Bengaluru, especially aiding commuters to the Electronics City tech hub.

item.title: SEBI relaxes norms for settling client accounts inactive for 30 days - The Economic Times
item.description:
SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

Publication Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has relaxed norms regarding the settlement of accounts by brokerages for clients who have not traded in over 30 days. This aims to improve efficiency and facilitate business.

  • The revised rules allow settlements for clients who trade again after 30 days and before the next monthly settlement cycle.
  • This change comes following concerns raised by the Brokers’ Industry Standards Forum regarding procedural inefficiencies.
  • Settlements are now to be aligned with the annual calendar of settlements notified by exchanges.
  • The new provisions take effect immediately.
"It has been decided to revise the requirement of mandatory settlement of such clients’ funds." - SEBI circular

This regulatory change is expected to streamline processes and enhance the ease of doing business for brokerages while safeguarding investor interests.

item.title: Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 13.32x as NIIs led bid; Check GMP, subscription data | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates

Date: 6 Jan, 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Standard Glass Lining IPO launches today with a price band of ₹133-140 per share, aiming to raise ₹410.05 crore. The issue was subscribed 13.32x on the first day as NIIs led the bidding.

  • The IPO opened for subscription on January 6 and will close on January 8.
  • It secured ₹123 crore from anchor investors ahead of the launch.
  • Reviews indicate substantial interest, with shares trading at a ₹97 premium in the grey market.
  • The issue consists of a fresh issuance and an offer for sale of shares by promoters.
  • Proceeds will be allocated for debt repayment and investment in a subsidiary.
The NII portion led the bidding round at 25.43x, followed by retail investors at 14.46x.

In summary, the Standard Glass Lining IPO is generating significant interest, reflecting a positive market outlook.

item.title: RBL Bank stock gains 2.5% following healthy December quarter business update | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
RBL Bank Stock Gains 2.5% Following Healthy December Quarter Business Update

Date: January 6, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Shares of RBL Bank ended higher at ₹166.80 apiece, marking a 2.46% gain as investors reacted positively to the bank's December quarter business update released over the weekend.

  • The stock has risen for the third consecutive day, gaining 5.6% in January 2024.
  • RBL Bank reported a 15% year-on-year increase in deposits, reaching ₹92,746 crore for Q3FY25.
  • Retail advances grew 20% YoY, and wholesale advances increased 5% YoY for the quarter ended December 31, 2024.
  • Current bucket collection efficiency for microfinance advances was 98.4% in December 2024.
  • Deposits below ₹3 crore made up approximately 50.3% of total deposits as of December 31, 2024.
“The bank continues to focus on growing the share of granular retail deposits in its overall deposit mix.”

Despite previous challenges, including a drop in standalone net profit by 24% YoY in Q2FY25, the current updates reflect a healthier financial position for the bank.

item.title: Market Wrap, January 6: Bears roar loud and clear; SENSEX, NIFTY50 sink 1.6%; top factors behind crash today - Upstox
item.description:
Market Wrap, January 6: Bears Roar Loud and Clear; SENSEX, NIFTY50 Sink 1.6%

Date: January 6, 2025   Source: Market News

Major stock market indices in India, including SENSEX and NIFTY50, experienced significant declines, driven by investor panic over a new respiratory virus scare and weak global cues.

Key Points

  • S&P BSE SENSEX closed at 77,964.99, down 1,258.12 points (1.59%)
  • NSE NIFTY50 closed at 23,616.05, down 388.70 points (1.62%)
  • Investor wealth dropped by ₹10.98 lakh crore
  • First cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) detected in India raised market fears
  • FII selling led to significant equity offloads worth ₹4,227.25 crore
“The outbreak of the HMPV virus unnerved investors.”

Notable Quotes:

“Volatility Index is a measure of the amount by which an underlying index is expected to fluctuate in the near term.”

Continuous selling by foreign institutional investors added to market declines, with all major sectors witnessing downturns, particularly in PSU banks.

Conclusion

The combination of new health concerns and sustained foreign selling has left Indian markets in a vulnerable position as investors brace for further volatility.

item.title: HMPV scare: Sensex, Nifty crash over 1.5% amid foreign fund outflows, concerns over earning season - The Hindu
item.description:
HMPV scare: Sensex, Nifty crash over 1.5% amid foreign fund outflows, concerns over earning season

Published: January 06, 2025 04:26 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

The Indian benchmark equity indices, Sensex and Nifty, experienced a significant decline on January 6, 2025, due to a selloff linked to concerns over third-quarter earnings and the outflow of foreign capital amid fears surrounding the HMP virus.

  • Sensex dropped by 1,258.12 points (1.59%) closing at 77,964.99.
  • Nifty fell by 388.70 points (1.62%) to end at 23,616.05.
  • Sectoral losses primarily affected companies like Tata Steel, NTPC, and Reliance Industries.
  • Only Titan and Sun Pharma gained in the market.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold equities worth ₹4,227.25 crore.
"The sell-off can be attributed to a rise in Foreign Institutional Investor (FII) selling and concerns surrounding the upcoming Q3 earnings season." - Santosh Meena, Head of Research, Swastika Investmart

The significant downturn reflects the increasing negative sentiment in the market driven by external factors and investor concerns.

item.title: After Losing To Tata Motors, Maruti Announces Heavy Discounts! - MotorOctane
item.description:
After Losing To Tata Motors, Maruti Announces Heavy Discounts!

Date & Source: January 2025, MotorOctane

In an effort to boost sales this January, Maruti has unveiled generous discounts across various models, focusing particularly on competing with Tata Motors.

  • The highest discount is on the Maruti Invicto, offering up to Rs 2.15 lakh for 2024 models.
  • Discounts for the hybrid SUV Grand Vitara reach Rs 1.18 lakh, plus extended warranty options.
  • The Maruti Jimny offers discounts of up to Rs 1.9 lakh on the older model variants.
"The given discount is all inclusive of cash discounts, exchange bonus/scrappage, corporate offer and rural offer."

With these discounts, Maruti aims to attract more buyers and regain market competitiveness in the face of Tata Motors' growth.

item.title: These stocks are already down 7-10% in the first four sessions of 2025 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks Experience Significant Declines in Early 2025 Trading Sessions

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

The article discusses the decline in stock prices of several companies during the first four trading sessions of 2025, highlighting those that dropped between 7% to 11%.

  • Crisil Ltd. declined by 11% across all trading days.
  • Aditya Birla Real Estate fell by 10%, declining on three out of four days.
  • Asahi India Glass saw a drop of 9.2% over the first four days.
  • NLC India experienced an 8% decline with three drops in four days.
  • Can Fin Homes also fell by 8%, declining every day of trading.
  • Adani Total Gas dropped by 7.5% during the four-day period.
  • Jindal SAW had a decrease of 7.3%, declining on two days.
  • Eris Lifesciences fell by 7.1%, declining on all four days.
  • Bajaj Holdings reported a 7% decline, with three losses out of four trading days.
“The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on CNBCTV18.com are their own and not that of the website or its management.”

This report indicates a concerning start to 2025 for various stocks, which may prompt investors to reconsider their strategies in the current market environment.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric vs Maruti e Vitara vs Mahindra BE 6 vs Tata Curvv EV vs MG ZS EV: Power Figures Comparison - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric vs Maruti e Vitara vs Mahindra BE 6 vs Tata Curvv EV vs MG ZS EV: Power Figures Comparison

Date & Source: CarDekho.com

The power figures for the Hyundai Creta Electric have been revealed alongside its interior features. The details compare its power outputs against other electric SUVs in the market.

  • Hyundai Creta Electric offers two battery options: 135 PS for the 42 kWh pack and 171 PS for the 51.4 kWh pack.
  • Competitors include Mahindra BE 6 with up to 286 PS, Maruti e Vitara providing dual motor options, Tata Curvv EV, and MG ZS EV.
  • The expected price for the Hyundai Creta Electric starts from Rs 17 lakh.
“The newest Mahindra EV, the BE 6, packs in the biggest battery pack options and produces the most power in this comparison.”

The power comparisons highlight the varying capabilities of these electric vehicles, indicating the competitive landscape in the EV market.

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex, Nifty 50 crack over 1.5% each; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex, Nifty 50 crack over 1.5% each; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff

Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw a significant downturn on January 6, with both Sensex and Nifty 50 experiencing declines of over 1.5%. This drop was primarily triggered by fears surrounding a new virus outbreak in China, alongside weak performances from major Asian markets.

Key Points:

  • Sensex closed down 1.59% at 77,964 points; Nifty 50 down 1.6% at 23,616 points.
  • Nifty Smallcap 100 and Midcap 100 indices also dropped significantly by 3.2% and 2.7%, respectively.
  • 46 of the 50 Nifty constituents ended the day in negative territory; ITC was the biggest loser, dropping 8.1%.
  • Weakness in Asian markets, particularly impacted by potential trade tariffs from the US.
  • Concerns over the detected Human Metapneumovirus in Bengaluru tied to respiratory illness spikes in China.
  • Technical analysis shows Nifty has broken key support levels, escalating selling pressure.
“Nifty holds a good view until it stays above its 200 DMA which is placed at 23,900...” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

In conclusion, the markets are reacting negatively to multiple factors, including international cues and health alerts, signaling potential challenges ahead for investors.

item.title: Q3 results this week: TCS, MobiKwik, DMart, IREDA, others to announce earnings; check list - Upstox
item.description:
Companies Announcing Q3 Earnings: TCS, MobiKwik, DMart, and More

This week, several companies will release their financial results for the third quarter. Key players include Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), MobiKwik, and the DMart operator Avenue Supermarts, among others.

The following companies are set to announce their Q3 FY25 results this week:

  • January 6, 2025: Emerald Finance, Longspur International Ventures, Samsrita Labs, Mapro Industries, Asian Flora.
  • January 7: One MobiKwik Systems, Darshan Orna, Kore Foods, GM Breweries, Krishna Ventures, UH Zaveri, Leel Electricals, VR Woodart.

TCS's leadership team will hold a press conference on January 9 at 5:30 PM.

The results forecast is generating substantial interest, especially with TCS announcing its expected dividend on January 17.

item.title: 'Bank Should Remain Vigilant' : Supreme Court Holds SBI Liable To Refund Amount To Customer Who Reported... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Bank Should Remain Vigilant: Supreme Court Holds SBI Liable To Refund Amount To Customer Who Reported...

Publication Date: Not specified Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court of India has ruled that banks, including the State Bank of India (SBI), hold responsibility for unauthorized transactions and must ensure they safeguard their customers. The court emphasized that account holders also need to be vigilant and refrain from sharing one-time passwords (OTPs).

  • The SBI was held liable for a fraudulent transaction totaling ₹94,204.80 that was reported by a customer.
  • The customer was a victim of fraud after sharing sensitive information under the pretense of customer support.
  • The High Court had previously directed SBI to refund the amount, a decision upheld by the Supreme Court.
  • RBI guidelines state zero liability for customers in cases of data breaches, if reported promptly.
  • The court stressed the importance of banks using advanced technology to prevent such fraudulent activities.
“All transactions relating to the account of the respondent No.1... were found to be unauthorized and fraudulent. It is the responsibility of the bank so far as such unauthorized and fraudulent transactions are concerned.”

The court concluded that customers must remain vigilant, recognizing their role in preventing unauthorized access while also ensuring that banks take appropriate measures to secure customer accounts.

item.title: THIS small-cap stock below ₹50 declares 5:1 bonus shares; do you own? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Small-cap Stock Gujarat Toolroom Declares 5:1 Bonus Shares

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Live Mint

The Gujarat Toolroom board has approved a 5:1 bonus issue, which will reward shareholders with five additional shares for every share owned. However, member approval is still needed.

The bonus shares are expected to be credited by March 6, 2025, increasing the company's paid-up share capital significantly.

  • The company will utilize ₹116 crore from its securities premium account and retained earnings.
  • Gujarat Toolroom’s share capital will rise from ₹23.20 crore to ₹139.23 crore.
  • The company reported a 1,016% year-on-year growth in quarterly net profit.
  • Sales rose by 72.65% in the same quarter.
  • Gujarat Toolroom raised ₹95.66 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP).
“Gujarat Toolroom is dedicated to rewarding its investors.”

This bonus share declaration reflects a commitment to growth and investor confidence, bolstered by strong financial results.

item.title: HPCL, IOC shares fall as crude oil prices rise - CNBCTV18
item.description:
HPCL and IOC Shares Drop Amid Rising Crude Oil Prices

Date: January 6, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of oil marketing companies fell sharply as crude oil prices continue to climb, leading to significant declines for HPCL, BPCL, and IOC.

  • HPCL shares tumbled 6% to ₹388.50.
  • BPCL shares decreased by 4% to ₹285.60.
  • IOC shares fell 3.99% to ₹132.63.
  • Brent crude is currently priced at $76.30 per barrel, with WTI at $73.77.
  • India Ratings maintains a 'neutral' outlook on the oil and gas sector for FY26.
  • Low crude prices are expected to impact upstream earnings, but margins should remain healthy.
"This would keep sufficient cushion in margin, with an estimated break-even cost of production at $40-45 a barrel, leaving Ebitda of $20-30 per barrel."

The ongoing rise in crude oil prices has led to immediate declines in oil marketing company shares, prompting observations about future pricing and production implications.

item.title: 'Real money is with...' - Zerodha's Nithin Kamath names 2 cities behind 80% of equity delivery trades - One is Mumbai, other is… - ET Now
item.description:
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath Names Key Cities in Equity Trading

Date & Source: Updated Jan 6, 2025, ET Now News

Leading stock broker Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has revealed that Ahmedabad and Mumbai together account for 80% of equity delivery trades in India. This highlights a significant shift in trading dynamics, despite Gujarat's strong trading history.

  • Ahmedabad and Mumbai account for 80% of equity delivery trades.
  • Gujarat, though historically active in trading, now represents only 8% of total registered investors.
  • Maharashtra had the highest number of registered investors in the current fiscal year.
“Essentially, the real money is with Gujjus.” - Nithin Kamath

This information indicates the changing landscape of equity trading in India, as traditional strongholds like Gujarat face a decline in registered investor share.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric Interior Revealed, Top Features Announced - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric Interior Revealed, Top Features Announced

Date: January 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai India has provided a first look at the upcoming Creta Electric’s interior, which features significant upgrades and similar layouts to its ICE counterpart.

  • Similar dashboard layout as the ICE-powered model.
  • New three-spoke steering wheel, black and white cabin theme with purple ambient lighting.
  • Top features include dual 10.25-inch displays, digital key, Bose sound system, and panoramic sunroof.
  • Safety includes six airbags, electronic stability control, and Level-2 ADAS.
  • Offers 135 PS and 171 PS e-motors with different range options.
  • Prices to be announced on January 17 at Auto Expo 2025.
“The dashboard looks modern with dual digital displays and physical controls for important functions.”

The Hyundai Creta Electric is poised to be a strong competitor in the electric SUV market with its advanced features and safety technology.

item.title: Tata Motors Ends Maruti Suzuki’s 40-Year Run As Maker Of India’s Best-Selling Car - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Tata Motors Ends Maruti Suzuki’s 40-Year Run As Maker Of India’s Best-Selling Car

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

The Tata Punch has become India’s best-selling car in 2024, ending a 40-year streak for Maruti Suzuki, which dominated the market for decades.

  • The Tata Punch outsold all other models, including Maruti Suzuki's WagonR and Ertiga.
  • It was the only vehicle to exceed 200,000 units sold in 2024.
  • Consumer preferences in India have shifted significantly towards sub-compact SUVs.
  • Overall car sales in India increased by nearly 28% from 2018 to 2024.
The Tata Punch topped the chart with 2.02 lakh sold units. Maruti Suzuki's WagonR and Ertiga were the runner-ups, with sales of around 1.9 lakh units.

This shift in consumer preference towards larger vehicles may indicate a long-term change in the automotive landscape in India.
